topic.title: Adding Custom Dictionaries for the Spell Checker

keywords.indexterm: Oxygen XML Web Author ComponentSpell Checker custom dictionaries
Spell Checker custom dictionaries in Web Author

body.p: includes an automatic spell checking feature and you can customize the words that are detected by adding custom dictionaries.

To add a custom dictionary, follow these steps:
Download the files needed for your custom dictionary (or create your own). You will need a dictionary file (.dic file extension) and an affix file (.aff file extension). If the dictionary did not include an affix file (.aff), you can create one and leave it empty, but it is needed for the mechanism to work properly.An example of a website that includes numerous dictionary files is: .
Copy both files (.dic and .aff) to the dicts folder that is located within your installation directory, depending on your distribution method. For example, the default location for a Windows, Linux, or All Platforms distribution is: \tomcat\work\Catalina\localhost\oxygen-xml-web-author\dicts, unless you have specified another location with the oxygen.data.dir system property.The name of the dictionary file should begin with a two letter prefix that indicates the language it should be attached to, followed by an underscore or hyphen (for example, en_medical.dic for a medical dictionary in the English language). For a list of language codes, see .
Restart the server for the spell checker to start using the new dictionary.
